form.official-title: To amend titles II and XVIII of the Social Security Act to eliminate the disability insurance benefits waiting period for individuals with disabilities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop the Wait Act of 2022.

section.header: Elimination of disability waiting period for social security disability insurance benefits

subsection.header: Elimination of waiting period for disability insurance benefits
subsection.text: Section 223 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 423) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), in the matter following subparagraph (E)—

clause.text: by striking disability insurance benefit (i) for each month and all that follows through , or (iii) and inserting disability insurance benefit; and
by striking , but only if and all that follows through under such disability; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking as though he had attained age 62 in— and all that follows through such disability insurance benefits, and inserting as though the individual had attained age 62 in the first month for which the individual becomes entitled to such disability insurance benefits,; and
in the subsection heading, by striking Definitions of Insured Status and Waiting Period and inserting Definition of Insured Status;

by striking For purposes of this section and all that follows through in any month if— and inserting For purposes of this section, an individual shall be insured for disability insurance benefits in any month if—;
by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as paragraphs (1) and (2), respectively (and adjusting the margins accordingly);

clause.text: by redesignating clauses (i), (ii), and (iii) as subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C), respectively; and
in subparagraph (C) (as so redesignated), by striking clause (i) and inserting subparagraph (A); and

subparagraph.text: in the matter following subparagraph (C) (as so redesignated), by striking subparagraph (B) of this paragraph each place it appears and inserting this paragraph.

subsection.header: Phase-Down of waiting period for disability insurance benefits
subsection.text: For purposes of applications for disability insurance benefits filed on or after the date of enactment of this Act and before January 1, 2027, section 223(c)(2) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 423(c)(2)) shall be applied by making the following substitutions:

paragraph.text: For applications filed in calendar year 2022, 2023, or 2024, substitute three for five and fifteenth for seventeenth each place it appears.
For applications filed in calendar year 2025, substitute two for five and fourteenth for seventeenth each place it appears.
For applications filed in calendar year 2026, substitute one for five and thirteenth for seventeenth each place it appears.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall take effect on January 1, 2027, and apply with respect to applications for disability insurance benefits filed on or after January 1, 2027.

paragraph.text: Section 223(a)(1)(A) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 423(a)(1)(A)) is amended by striking (c)(1) and inserting (c).
Section 7(d)(3) of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 (45 U.S.C. 231f(d)(3)) is amended by striking 223(c)(1) and inserting 223(c).

section.header: Medicare eligibility for certain individuals during waiting period for Social Security Disability Insurance benefits

subsection.header: Elimination of waiting period for certain individuals without minimum essential coverage

paragraph.text: Section 226 the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 426) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
For purposes of applying this section in the case of an eligible individual described in paragraph (2), the following special rules shall apply:

subparagraph.text: Subsection (b)(2) shall be applied as if there were no requirement for any entitlement to benefits, or status, for a period of 24 months prior to receiving such benefits or status.
The entitlement under such subsection shall be available retroactively to the first day of the first month (rather than twenty-fifth month) of entitlement or status.

paragraph.text: For purposes of applying this section, an eligible individual is an individual, with respect to a month—

subparagraph.text: who has not yet attained the age of 65;
who is entitled to benefits described in subparagraph (A) of subsection (b)(2); and
with respect to whom section 5000A(e)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 would apply if the reference to 8 percent in such section were a reference to 8.5 percent.

paragraph.text: Section 1811 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395c) is amended—

subparagraph.text: at the end of paragraph (2), by striking and;
by striking the period at the end and inserting , and; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subsection.header: Special enrollment period and coverage application for certain individuals without minimum essential coverage
subsection.text: Section 1837 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395p) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: In applying this section in the case of an eligible individual who is entitled to benefits under part A pursuant to the operation of section 226(j), the following special rules shall apply:

subparagraph.text: The initial enrollment period under subsection (d) shall begin on the first day of the first month in which the individual satisfies the requirement of section 1836(a)(1).
In applying subsection (g)(1), the initial enrollment period shall begin on the first day of the first month of entitlement to disability insurance benefits referred to in such subsection.

paragraph.text: In applying this section in the case of an individual who became entitled to benefits under part A, but had not been entitled to such benefits for a period of 24 calendar months as of the date of enactment of the Stop the Wait Act of 2022, and is entitled to such benefits pursuant to the application of section 226(j), the initial enrollment period under subsection (d) for such individual shall begin on the first day of the first month following the date of enactment of the Stop the Wait Act of 2022 and shall end seven months later.
